summary: This is an email chain from November 27, 2019, discussing the organization and naming conventions for files related to the Epstein investigation, specifically referencing 302s, photos, and proffer notes. The emails show coordination among team members about saving documents in the 'Epstein witness folder' with proper naming conventions.

events.title: Email coordination on Epstein investigation files
events.description: Team members exchange emails about organizing 302s, photos, and proffer notes related to the Epstein investigation, emphasizing the importance of consistent file naming conventions for prosecution.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated November 27, 2019, discussing the Epstein investigation.
The emails reference organizing '302s, photos, & Proffer notes' for the 'Epstein witness folder'.
The importance of consistent file naming conventions for federal prosecution is emphasized.
All personal names in the email headers appear to be redacted or obscured (e.g., <MIMIIM>, aNIMIN>).
The correspondence shows ongoing investigative work and evidence management in the Epstein case as of late 2019.
